intro: Ardisia oocarpa, commonly known as the purple-berried ardisia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Following flowering, it produces small, dark purple berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia oocarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and seasonal fruit display.
